intro: Holosteum marginatum, commonly known as the margined holosteum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, erect stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Holosteum marginatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
